data.title: Japan joins US in proposing more aid to North Korea - Democratic People's Republic of Korea
data.meta_description: News and Press Release in English on Democratic People's Republic of Korea; published on 23 Jun 1997 by ABC
data.text:
(11:36am AEST)

Japan has expressed a willingness to join President Bill Clinton in providing more aid to famine-stricken North Korea.

Japanese Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto has hinted he is prepared to drop his refusal to give aid to North Korea.

Japan has been reluctant to join South Korea and the United States in providing additional food aid to North Korea due to alleged abductions of Japanese nationals.

Earlier, President Clinton expressed hope that those countries which attended the G-8 meeting in Denver, Colorado, would join the U-S in contributing aid to North Korea.

Estimates by international aid officials say that of North Korea's 23-million people, an estimated five million are close to starvation.

=A9 1996 Australian Broadcasting Corporation

Mon Jun 23 12:00:03 1997 ( AEST )

AEST = Australian Eastern Standard Time which is 10 hours ahead of UTC (Greenwich Mean Time)
